lines.text: A gun, like any other source of power, is a force for either good or evil, being neither in itself, but dependent upon those who possess it.
The first Colt repeating pistols in this territory, Sheriff. The finest guns ever made. Here's law and order in six-finger doses. Yes, sir, easy to load and as durable as your mother-in-law.
A pistol don't make a man. It's the gent before the gun that counts.
I died a hundred times while you were in there.
Chief, if you break the peace now, you'll make enemies of a lot of innocent people.
Dead enemies are best way to peace.
He's an animal. You should have seen him behind those guns today. I think he kills just to see men die.

[to Miller with contempt]
Pour yourself some backbone and shut up!
You our friend with plenty trouble. Need our help.
I guess I did at that... Thanks, Chief!
[Looking at body of dead bad guy]
I won't get anything from him.

[Shrugs comically]
Him no good for talk all right.

[to Brett]
You're like a disease with you - something that eats from the inside.

[Referring to two captive bad guys]
Got two more... fast and quiet. Indian always move quiet.

[to Brett]
There's another pair of .45's out there now... and a better man.
